abstract: Steven Baronoff, one of Merrill’s most senior deal-makers, will take over the firm’s mergers and acquisitions business as its current head, Jeffrey Kaplan, moves to Appaloosa Management.
snippet: Steven Baronoff, one of Merrill’s most senior deal-makers, will take over the firm’s mergers and acquisitions business as its current head, Jeffrey Kaplan, moves to Appaloosa Management.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America Merrill Lynch will again hand the reins of its mergers and acquisitions group to Steven Baronoff as the team’s current head, Jeffrey Kaplan, will leave to join the hedge fund Appaloosa Management, the firm said in an internal memorandum obtained by DealBook.

headline.main: Baronoff to Lead Merrill’s M.&A. Team Again

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
